Log messages are stored in System RAM using a Block Memory buffering mechanism and sent out to the Shared HCI System UART Asynchronously by a background Context. (Calling context is not Blocked and returns before the Log messages have been sent out)

***Warning: Seperate Auxillary Uart must be present in Product for this setting to work***. Log messages are stored in System RAM using a Memory Block buffering mechanism and sent out to a dedicated Auxillary UART Asynchronously by a background Context. (Calling context is not Blocked and returns before the Log messages have been sent out)

***Warning: Seperate Auxillary Uart must be present in Product for this setting to work***. Log messages are sent out to the dedicated Auxillary UART Synchronously. Here the Calling context is Blocking while the Log message is being sent and returns only after the message is completely sent out.

***Warning: Seperate Auxillary Uart must be present in Product for this setting to work***. Log messages are stored in System RAM using a Ring Memory buffering mechanism and sent out to dedicated Auxillary UART Asynchronously by a background Context. (Calling context is not Blocked and returns before the Log messages have been sent out)
Disables all voice loopback overrides. Audio will be looped back or not based on the current mode of operation.

Local and remote loopback at the ACI layer. Locally, the ACI copies all received audio bus data back out over the audio bus. Remotely, the ACI sends all FromAir voice data that comes down the voice stack back up the voice stack as ToAir data.

Local loopback near the Codec voice stack layer. This loopback sits just below the codec layer in the voice stack. Locally, ToAir data that has been rate-adapted to the OTA timing will get looped back as FromAir data in the next interval, rate-adapted back to the sample interface timing in the process.

Remote loopback near the Codec voice stack layer. This loopback sits just below the codec layer in the voice stack. Remotely, FromAir data that has been decoded will get looped back as ToAir data in the next interval, encoding in the process.

Local and remote loopback near the Codec voice stack layer. This loopback sits just below the codec layer in the voice stack. Locally, ToAir data that has been rate-adapted to the OTA timing will get looped back as FromAir data in the next interval, rate-adapted back to the sample interface timing in the process. Remotely, FromAir data that has been decoded will get looped back as ToAir data in the next interval, encoding in the process.

Local loopback near the OTA voice stack layer. This loopback sits just below the OTA interface and EDP. Locally, ToAir data that has been encoded will get looped back as FromAir data in the next interval, decoding in the process.

Remote loopback near the OTA voice stack layer. This loopback sits just below the OTA interface and EDP. Remotely, FromAir data that has been processed with EDP (bitwise majority voting) will get looped back as ToAir data in the next window.

Local and remote loopback near the OTA voice stack layer. This loopback sits just below the OTA interface and EDP. Locally, ToAir data that has been encoded will get looped back as FromAir data in the next interval, decoding in the process. Remotely, FromAir data that has been processed with EDP (bitwise majority voting) will get looped back as ToAir data in the next window.

Allocate stack memory from upper heap.

Separate DAC sweep for AMAM and AMPM calibrations.

Use the weighted bit error rate rate algorithm when evaluating EDR packets for CQDDR.

structure_element.name: ACL Automatic Flush
structure_element.label: ACL Automatic Flush
structure_element.description_user: Automatic Flush processing requires time tags associated with each HCI ACL First Packet of a Higher Layer message. This utilizes 4 bytes of the tx buffer size allocated in Tag 71. The HCI Read Buffer Size Command ACL data packet length will be 4 bytes less when this feature is enabled. This control disables automatic flush processing and the need to time tag HCI ACL packets.

structure_element.name: FRA_WEIGHTING
structure_element.label: FRA_WEIGHTING
structure_element.description_user: The weighting given to repeats of ARQN 0s or 1s. Value stored in Q15. Default is 1/8.

structure_element.name: FRA_HIGH_THRESH
structure_element.label: FRA_HIGH_THRESH
structure_element.description_user: The threshold that must be crossed to move from prohibiting 3DH packets to allowing 3DH packets. Number is held in Q15 format. Default is 0.9.

structure_element.name: FRA_LOW_THRESH
structure_element.label: FRA_LOW_THRESH
structure_element.description_user: The threshold that must be crossed from allowing 3DH packets to prohibiting 3DH packets. The number is held in Q15 format. Default is 0.4.

structure_element.name: FRA_MAX_RETRANS
structure_element.label: FRA_MAX_RETRANS

structure_element.name: FRA_ENABLED
structure_element.label: FRA_ENABLED

structure_element.name: HW Flow Control En
structure_element.label: HW Flow Control En
structure_element.description_user: Configure UART HW FLOW CONTROL. Set 1 to enable or 0 to disable HW Flow Control.

structure_element.name: FIFO Empty Entries to Flow Off
structure_element.label: FIFO Empty Entries to Flow Off
structure_element.description_user: If the number of empty entries in the Rx FIFO falls below this number, the host will be flowed off.

structure_element.name: 8 Byte FIFO
structure_element.label: 8 Byte FIFO
structure_element.description_user: When set to 1 this will enable the 8 byte FIFO. When set to 0, the default 2 byte FIFO will be used.

structure_element.name: Integer Rate Divisor
structure_element.label: Integer Rate Divisor
structure_element.description_user: Integer Baud Rate divisor; Formula's to Calculate Baud Rate Registers: ibrd = ( BBCLK/(8*BAUD) ); For SiW1750/1760: BBCLK = 16,000,000; For the SiW3000 : BBCLK = 32,000,000; For QCA6174 2.x : BBCLK = 32,000,000; For QCA6174 3.x : BBCLK = 32,000,000 or 64,000,000

structure_element.name: Wake Byte Required
structure_element.label: Wake Byte Required
structure_element.description_user: When enabled (set to 1), an actual Wake byte must be received to respond with a Wake Ack byte. When disabled, a Wake Ack byte will be sent on wakeup due to any Rx activity.

structure_element.name: Dynamic Wake Retransmit Timeout
structure_element.label: Dynamic Wake Retransmit Timeout
structure_element.description_user: Wake Retransmit Timeout can be set to either constant value always or can be configured to increment dynamically based on number of Wake Indication Timeouts. When this BIT is set to 1: Wake Retransmit timeout will increment linearly. For example if the Wake Retransmit timeout is set to 10msec then Wake Indication will be sent out at 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60msec timeouts.

structure_element.name: Host GPIO Control
structure_element.label: Host GPIO Control
structure_element.description_user: Bit0: Enable Host GPIO Control. 0==Device GPIO Control (default), 1==Host GPIO Control.

structure_element.name: Enable LL Logger
structure_element.label: Enable LL Logger
structure_element.description_user: Bit1: Enables logger output from the Lower Layer stack. 0==LL logger disabled (default), 1==LL logger enabled.

structure_element.name: Enable UL Logger
structure_element.label: Enable UL Logger
structure_element.description_user: Bit2: Enables logger output from the Upper Layer stack. 0==UL logger disabled (default), 1==UL logger enabled.

structure_element.name: Reserved_Bit_0
structure_element.label: Reserved_Bit_0
structure_element.description_user: Bit3: This bit has been deprecated for BT65_A1 and beyond. Please use relevant field in "Logger Params"

structure_element.name: Inhibit VS NOP Command Complete
structure_element.label: Inhibit VS NOP Command Complete
structure_element.description_user: Bit4: Inhibits the sending of Command Complete (with opcode of NOP) after processing all Vendor Specific HCI commands, for compatibility with older scripts. Default==0.

structure_element.name: IOP Run From ROM
structure_element.label: IOP Run From ROM
structure_element.description_user: Bit5: Used to debug Bali by forcing the IOP code to execute directly out of ROM. Otherwise, the IOP code will copy itself to RAM and run from there. Default = 0 (run from RAM).

structure_element.name: Display Stacks
structure_element.label: Display Stacks
structure_element.description_user: Bit6: 1: Enable Display of IRQ, FIQ, SYS, and Task Stacks sizes and free every 10 seconds. 0: Disable the display.

structure_element.name: Disable Nap
structure_element.label: Disable Nap
structure_element.description_user: Bit7: 1: Disable the Nap (Pause) feature for easier JTAG debugging. 0: Enable Nap feature.

structure_element.name: Enable ISR Logger
structure_element.label: Enable ISR Logger
structure_element.description_user: Bit8: Enable PF_DBG_ISR API's to support SLC layer logging.

structure_element.name: Topology Logging
structure_element.label: Topology Logging
structure_element.description_user: Bit9: Enable Topology Log messages. This option requires the ISR Logger.

structure_element.name: Display Heap Stats
structure_element.label: Display Heap Stats
structure_element.description_user: Bit10: When Enabled, Display the Upper and Lower Heap Statistics at the time of Idle Task.

structure_element.name: Assert Log Crash
structure_element.label: Assert Log Crash
structure_element.description_user: Bit11: When set ASSERT_LOG will be configured to initiate the crash dump instead of Error Log.

structure_element.name: Bus Error Interrupt
structure_element.label: Bus Error Interrupt
structure_element.description_user: Bit12: Enable the Bus Error Interrupt

structure_element.name: AHB Timeout Interrupt
structure_element.label: AHB Timeout Interrupt
structure_element.description_user: Bit14: Enable the AHB Timeout Interrupt

structure_element.name: RAM Mask Interrupt
structure_element.label: RAM Mask Interrupt
structure_element.description_user: Bit15: Disable the RAM Mask Interrupt

structure_element.name: RAM Mask RGN0 Interrupt
structure_element.label: RAM Mask RGN0 Interrupt
structure_element.description_user: Disable the RAM Mask RGN0 Interrupt

structure_element.name: RAM Mask RGN1 Interrupt
structure_element.label: RAM Mask RGN1 Interrupt
structure_element.description_user: Disable the RAM Mask RGN1 Interrupt

structure_element.name: NBLK Logger Memory Usage
structure_element.label: NBLK Logger Memory Usage
structure_element.description_user: Not used for ROME. Total memory for logger is defined in oscfg instead.

structure_element.name: NBLK Logger Memory Block Size
structure_element.label: NBLK Logger Memory Block Size
structure_element.description_user: Not used for ROME. Memory block size for logger is defined in oscfg instead.

structure_element.name: NBLK Stats Timer Interval
structure_element.label: NBLK Stats Timer Interval
structure_element.description_user: Timer Interval (Secs) to display Logger Statistics/Info, when Logger is in NonBlocking (Asynchronous) Mode. A value of 0 turns off the Statistics Display.

structure_element.name: Commands at HCI Task Enable
structure_element.label: Commands at HCI Task Enable
structure_element.description_user: Enable Logging of HCI Commands sent down from Host to SoC (seen @ the HCI Task)

structure_element.name: Events at HCI Task Enable
structure_element.label: Events at HCI Task Enable
structure_element.description_user: Enable Logging of HCI Events sent from Soc to the Host (seen @ the HCI Task)

structure_element.name: Commands at LLM Task Enable
structure_element.label: Commands at LLM Task Enable
structure_element.description_user: Enable Logging of HCI Commands sent to SoC from the host (seen @ the LLM Task)

structure_element.name: State at LLM Task Enable
structure_element.label: State at LLM Task Enable
structure_element.description_user: Enable Logging of State information (seen @ the LLM Task)

structure_element.name: Info at LLM Task Enable
structure_element.label: Info at LLM Task Enable
structure_element.description_user: Enable Logging of Debug information (@ the LLM Task)

structure_element.name: Overwrite Prev Logs
structure_element.label: Overwrite Prev Logs
structure_element.description_user: 0: Drop the latest logs when log buffers are not available. 1: Dequeue the previous log buffer from Dbg Queue and use it for latest logs.

structure_element.name: Dynamic Logging Enable
structure_element.label: Dynamic Logging Enable
structure_element.description_user: 0: When HOST is in sleep don't send the logs immediately. Wait until HOST is awake. 1: Send out the Logs as when they are queued to transmit to HOST.

structure_element.name: Is Expect Fatal
structure_element.label: Is Expect Fatal
structure_element.description_user: Set 1 to Consider EXPECT as FATAL.

structure_element.name: Txp Assert Fatal
structure_element.label: Txp Assert Fatal
structure_element.description_user: When set, a transport layer error will cause a fatal assert. When not set, a transport layer error will cause a Hardware Error event to be sent to the host only.

structure_element.name: Voice_Audio_Log
structure_element.label: Voice_Audio_Log
structure_element.description_user: Flag to enable/disable IOP Voice/Audio buffers dump.

structure_element.name: SLC Dynamic Logging Enable
structure_element.label: SLC Dynamic Logging Enable
structure_element.description_user: 0: When HOST is in sleep don't send the logs immediately. Wait until HOST is awake. 1: Send out the Logs as when they are queued to transmit to HOST.

structure_element.name: VSE Log Enable
structure_element.label: VSE Log Enable
structure_element.description_user: Enable mask for VS Event Logs

structure_element.name: Route Enh Log to Hydra Log
structure_element.label: Route Enh Log to Hydra Log
structure_element.description_user: Routes enhanced logging to hydra logging.0-Off;1-On

structure_element.name: FailureRateThreshold
structure_element.label: FailureRateThreshold
structure_element.description_user: In one period, if failure rate exceeds this threshold, this period will be regarded as glitch happened.

structure_element.name: GlitchCountThreshold
structure_element.label: GlitchCountThreshold
structure_element.description_user: In one report interval, if the glitches happen more than this threshold, need report to host.

structure_element.name: ACL
structure_element.label: ACL
structure_element.description_user: Number of header FEC errors allowed before NACKing an ACL packet

structure_element.name: SCO
structure_element.label: SCO
structure_element.description_user: Number of header FEC errors allowed before NACKing a SCO packet

structure_element.name: Drift Rate BTC
structure_element.label: Drift Rate BTC
structure_element.description_user: PPM Drift Rate for BT Classical (Default: 0x2D, 45d)

structure_element.name: Advertising Power Level Index
structure_element.label: Advertising Power Level Index
structure_element.description_user: Advertising power level index (Default=0x7, 7d). Host can control range by limiting Tx Output Power. This Tx Power is used for Advertising and Scan Response. Negative PL can be specified as 0x20(-1) ~ 0x23(-4).

structure_element.name: Scan Request Power Level Index
structure_element.label: Scan Request Power Level Index
structure_element.description_user: Scan Request Tx Power Level Index (Default=0x7, 7d). Host can control range by limiting Tx Output Power. Negative PL can be specified as 0x20(-1) ~ 0x23(-4).

structure_element.name: Connection Power Level Index
structure_element.label: Connection Power Level Index
structure_element.description_user: Connection power level index (Default=0x7, 7d). Negative PL can be specified as 0x20(-1) ~ 0x23(-4).

structure_element.name: MultiAdvTxPower_min
structure_element.label: MultiAdvTxPower_min
structure_element.description_user: Negative PL can be specified as 0x20(-1) ~ 0x23(-4).

structure_element.name: MultiAdvTxPower_low
structure_element.label: MultiAdvTxPower_low
structure_element.description_user: Negative PL can be specified as 0x20(-1) ~ 0x23(-4).

structure_element.name: MultiAdvTxPower_mid
structure_element.label: MultiAdvTxPower_mid
structure_element.description_user: Negative PL can be specified as 0x20(-1) ~ 0x23(-4).

structure_element.name: MultiAdvTxPower_high
structure_element.label: MultiAdvTxPower_high
structure_element.description_user: Negative PL can be specified as 0x20(-1) ~ 0x23(-4).

structure_element.name: MultiAdvTxPower_max
structure_element.label: MultiAdvTxPower_max
structure_element.description_user: Negative PL can be specified as 0x20(-1) ~ 0x23(-4).

structure_element.name: small

structure_element.name: Use BR EDR Default
structure_element.label: Use BR EDR Default
structure_element.description_user: 0 - Use dynamic calculation based on sync word 1 - Use default values

structure_element.name: Use LE 1Mbps Default
structure_element.label: Use LE 1Mbps Default
structure_element.description_user: 0 - Use dynamic calculation based on sync word 1 - Use default values

structure_element.name: Use LE 2Mbps Default
structure_element.label: Use LE 2Mbps Default
structure_element.description_user: 0 - Use dynamic calculation based on sync word 1 - Use default values

structure_element.name: Use ANT Default
structure_element.label: Use ANT Default
structure_element.description_user: 0 - Use dynamic calculation based on sync word 1 - Use default values

structure_element.name: PRIORITY_UPDATE_INTERVAL
structure_element.label: PRIORITY_UPDATE_INTERVAL
structure_element.description_user: Interval in which the periodic calibration dispatch priority shall be updated if preempted by other higher priory tasks. Unit in BT CLK LSB, 312.5 us. Default is 11 Sec

structure_element.name: MAX_DURATION
structure_element.label: MAX_DURATION
structure_element.description_user: Max duration for which the periodic calibration is allowed to run in a single shot. Unit in BT CLK LSB, 312.5 us. Default is 11 Sec

structure_element.name: n_samples_dc_avg
structure_element.label: n_samples_dc_avg
structure_element.description_user: Number of samples of DC notch output used for averaging.

structure_element.name: n_samples_fm
structure_element.label: n_samples_fm
structure_element.description_user: Number of IQ samples used for FM in bytes. So this value/4 will be the number of words filled with randon data.

structure_element.name: num_extp_pnts
structure_element.label: num_extp_pnts
structure_element.description_user: Number of points to be extrapolated.

structure_element.name: phase_offset
structure_element.label: phase_offset
structure_element.description_user: Shift the computed phase correction to be centered around this value.

structure_element.name: cal_temp
structure_element.label: cal_temp
structure_element.description_user: Temperature at which calibration is done

structure_element.name: Linear PCM MSB
structure_element.label: Linear PCM MSB
structure_element.description_user: Bits2_4: Linear PCM MSB (0=MSB is bit 15, 1=MSB is bit 14 etc.)

structure_element.name: Input Sign Format
structure_element.label: Input Sign Format
structure_element.description_user: Bits6_7: Input Sign Format (0=1's comp, 1=2's comp, 2=signed magnitude, 3=CVSD (SiW Vendor Specific)

structure_element.name: Audio SCO routing
structure_element.label: Audio SCO routing
structure_element.description_user: Bit 10: Create audio routing automatically on SCO link creation for Hydra architecture (1 - BTSS creates routing; 0 - do not create routing, another subsystem is expected to do this)

structure_element.name: Low threshold
structure_element.label: Low threshold
structure_element.description_user: This specifies the far_too_low threshold value in multiples of the number of samples required for framing an OTA packet. If sample count is less than this value the boost the ring.

structure_element.name: High threshold
structure_element.label: High threshold
structure_element.description_user: This specifies the far_too_high threshold value in multiples of the number of samples. If sample count exceeds this value then flush the ring.

structure_element.name: eSCO Vote Enable
structure_element.label: eSCO Vote Enable
structure_element.description_user: Enables eSCO packet bitwise majority voting as part of Rx Erroneous Data Processing. Default=1.

structure_element.name: NBS PLC Enable
structure_element.label: NBS PLC Enable
structure_element.description_user: Enables NBS Packet Loss Concealment. Default=1.

structure_element.name: NBS PLC Replace Single eSCO CRC Failure
structure_element.label: NBS PLC Replace Single eSCO CRC Failure
structure_element.description_user: If NBS PLC is enabled, this flag controls the handling of an eSCO window in which a single eSCO packet is received with a CRC failure (and all other sSCO packets were lost). If set to 1, then such a packet is discarded in favor of PLC. If set to 0, then such a packet is consumed as voice data. Default=1.

structure_element.name: WBS PLC Enable
structure_element.label: WBS PLC Enable
structure_element.description_user: Enables WBS Packet Loss Concealment. Default=1.

structure_element.name: Use MSBC For Transp Voice_Setting
structure_element.label: Use MSBC For Transp Voice_Setting
structure_element.description_user: If set, translates a legacy HCI Voice_Setting parameter of "Transparent Data" to "mSBC" instead, to force controller-based encoding/decoding of mSBC (WBS) voice data. If clear, a legacy Voice_Setting parameter of "Transparent Data" will be treated as transparent which will disable controller-based encoding/decoding.

structure_element.name: Use MSBC For Transp Coding_Format
structure_element.label: Use MSBC For Transp Coding_Format
structure_element.description_user: If set, translates an HCI Enhanced Setup (Accept) Synchronous Connection Command Transmit_Coding_Format/Receive_Coding_Format parameter of "Transparent" to "mSBC" instead. If clear, the Transmit_Coding_Format/Receive_Coding_Format parameter will be treated as transparent which will disable controller-based encoding/decoding.

structure_element.name: Channel
structure_element.label: Channel
structure_element.description_user: I2S / Codec channel or slot for PCM

structure_element.name: Instance
structure_element.label: Instance
structure_element.description_user: I2S / PCM instance. Not applicable for Codec

structure_element.label: high_power

structure_element.name: low_power
structure_element.label: low_power
structure_element.description_user: Remembrance factor/forget factor to be used at low RSSI levels while receiving GFSK modulated packets.

structure_element.label: pwr_thresh
structure_element.description_user: Power threshold to change the remembrance factor from high power to low power while receiving GFSK modulated packets.

structure_element.label: low_power

structure_element.name: pwr_thresh

structure_element.label: high_power

structure_element.name: Barge in
structure_element.label: Barge in
structure_element.description_user: Enable truncated page scan on primary during ACL relay. This provides incoming connection indications to host without making connections.

structure_element.name: GFSK Err Region
structure_element.label: GFSK Err Region
structure_element.description_user: This threshold sets the region where the GFSK demodulators decision metric will be used to calculate the error metric for GFSK

structure_element.name: DQPSK Err Region
structure_element.label: DQPSK Err Region
structure_element.description_user: This threshold sets the region where the DQPSK demodulators decision metric will be used to calculate the error metric for DQPSK

structure_element.name: D8PSK Err Region
structure_element.label: D8PSK Err Region
structure_element.description_user: This threshold sets the region where the D8PSK demodulators decision metric will be used to calculate the error metric for D8PSK

structure_element.name: GFSK Err
structure_element.label: GFSK Err
structure_element.description_user: If the error metric for GFSK is greater than this threshold, the erroneous_bit_detected is asserted

structure_element.name: DQPSK Err
structure_element.label: DQPSK Err
structure_element.description_user: If the error metric for DQPSK is greater than this threshold, the erroneous_bit_detected is asserted

structure_element.name: D8PSK Err
structure_element.label: D8PSK Err
structure_element.description_user: If the error metric for D8PSK is greater than this threshold, the erroneous_bit_detected is asserted

structure_element.name: Wake Retransmission Timeout
structure_element.label: Wake Retransmission Timeout
structure_element.description_user: Software In-Band Sleep Wake Retransmission Timeout in ms. Wake will be re-transmitted after this number of ms if a Wake Ack is not received.

structure_element.name: Tx Idle Timeout
structure_element.label: Tx Idle Timeout
structure_element.description_user: Software In-Band Sleep Tx Idle Timeout in ms. Sleep signal will be sent if Tx stays idle for the defined timeout period.

structure_element.name: max count
structure_element.label: max count
structure_element.description_user: minimum memory blocks allocated when memory pool is initialized.

structure_element.name: block size
structure_element.label: block size
structure_element.description_user: maximum memory blocks allowed to be allocated from memory pool.

structure_element.name: block size
structure_element.label: block size
structure_element.description_user: The size of each Tx buffer, in bytes (Default: 1036 (0x408)). The ACL_U Isochronous Flush mechanism clock tags each Tx HCI data packet. This allocation needs to account 4 bytes for this clock tag. Note: The BB Tx mechanism builds baseband ACL packets by concatenating up to three HCI Tx packets. If the specified Tx packet size is to small ( <117 bytes BR, <345 bytes EDR) smaller BT packets will be used to Tx the data.

structure_element.name: block size
structure_element.label: block size
structure_element.description_user: The size of each Rx buffer, in bytes (Default: 1028 (0x404)). Note: The baseband Rx mechanism expects a minimum Rx packet size of 64 bytes. If a smaller value is specified, ACL data traffic will stall due to insufficient buffering to handle an incomming BT Rx ACL packet.

structure_element.name: max count
structure_element.label: max count
structure_element.description_user: EC(2,5) creates 5 segments in one go. max vlaue is set to 10 to hold max 2 set of EC coded segments

structure_element.name: block size
structure_element.label: block size
structure_element.description_user: Max size = max data size of 2DH5 packet + 3(EC Header)

This control disables automatic flush processing and the need to time tag HCI ACL packets.

config_element.name: Dynamic Wake Retransmit Timeout
config_element.label: Dynamic Wake Retransmit Timeout
config_element.description_user: Wake Retransmit Timeout can be set to either constant value always or can be configured to increment dynamically based on number of Wake Indication Timeouts. When this BIT is set to 1: Wake Retransmit timeout will increment linearly. For example if the Wake Retransmit timeout is set to 10msec then Wake Indication will be sent out at 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60msec timeouts.

config_element.name: NBS PLC Replace Single eSCO CRC Failure

If set to 1, then such a packet is discarded in favor of PLC. If set to 0, then such a packet is consumed as voice data. Default=1.

config_element.name: Use MSBC For Transp Coding_Format
config_element.label: Use MSBC For Transp Coding_Format
config_element.description_user: If set, translates an HCI Enhanced Setup (Accept) Synchronous Connection Command Transmit_Coding_Format/Receive_Coding_Format parameter of "Transparent" to "mSBC" instead. If clear, the Transmit_Coding_Format/Receive_Coding_Format parameter will be treated as transparent which will disable controller-based encoding/decoding.

config_element.name: Use MSBC For Transp Voice_Setting
config_element.label: Use MSBC For Transp Voice_Setting
config_element.description_user: If set, translates a legacy HCI Voice_Setting parameter of "Transparent Data" to "mSBC" instead, to force controller-based encoding/decoding of mSBC (WBS) voice data. If clear, a legacy Voice_Setting parameter of "Transparent Data" will be treated as transparent which will disable controller-based encoding/decoding.

config_element.description_user: maximum memory blocks allowed to be allocated from memory pool.

config_element.name: block size
config_element.label: block size
config_element.description_user: The size of each Tx buffer, in bytes (Default: 1036 (0x408)). The ACL_U Isochronous Flush mechanism clock tags each Tx HCI data packet. This allocation needs to account 4 bytes for this clock tag. Note: The BB Tx mechanism builds baseband ACL packets by concatenating up to three HCI Tx packets. If the specified Tx packet size is to small ( <117 bytes BR, <345 bytes EDR) smaller BT packets will be used to Tx the data.

config_element.name: block size
config_element.label: block size
config_element.description_user: The size of each Rx buffer, in bytes (Default: 1028 (0x404)). Note: The baseband Rx mechanism expects a minimum Rx packet size of 64 bytes. If a smaller value is specified, ACL data traffic will stall due to insufficient buffering to handle an incomming BT Rx ACL packet.

config_element.description_user: Max size = max data size of 2DH5 packet + 3(EC Header)

config_element.description_user: Size of each HCI ISO RX buffer. 5 bytes for the ISO header.

config_element.name: SUPPORTED_FEATURES_MASK
config_element.label: SUPPORTED_FEATURES_MASK
config_element.description_user:
The format of the BT Supported Features is defined in the BT4.0 specification. The BTT_SUPPORTED_FEATURES_MASK is applied to the BT Supported Features such that a "0" bit forces the software to never support the given feature, while a "1" bit allows the software to support a given feature if the software is built with the required support.
Supported Features Mask fields:
Byte0: bitfield: 3-slot packets: Bit0: 3-slot packets 5-Slot packets: Bit1: 5-Slot packets Encryption: Bit2: Encryption Slot Offset: Bit3: Slot Offset Timing Accuracy: Bit4: Timing Accuracy Switch: Bit5: Switch Hold Mode: Bit6: Hold Mode Sniff Mode: Bit7: Sniff Mode
Byte1: bitfield: Park Mode: Bit0: Park Mode RSSI: Bit1: RSSI CQDDR: Bit2: Channel Quality Driven Data Rate SCO Link: Bit3: SCO Link HV2 Packets: Bit4: HV2 Packets HV3 Packets: Bit5: HV3 Packets u-Law log: Bit6: u-Law log A-Law log: Bit7: A-Law log
Byte2: bitfield: CVSD synchronous data: Bit0: CVSD synchronous data Paging parameter negotiation: Bit1: Paging parameter negotiation Power Control: Bit2: Power Control Transperant SCO Data: Bit3: Transperant SCO Data Flow Control Lag: Bit4_6: 3 Bits representing the Flow Control Lag Broadcast Encryption: Bit7: Broadcast Encryption
Byte3: bitfield: Reserved: Bit 0 : Reserved EDR ACL DQPSK mode: Bit1: EDR ACL DQPSK mode EDR ACL 8 DPSK mode: Bit2: EDR ACL 8 DPSK mode Enhanced inquiry scan: Bit3: Enhanced inquiry scan Interlaced inquiry scan: Bit4: Interlaced inquiry scan Interlaced page scan: Bit5: Interlaced page scan RSSI with inquiry results: Bit6: RSSI with inquiry results ESCO EV3 packets: Bit7: Extended SCO link (EV3 packets)
Byte4: bitfield: EV4 packets: Bit0: EV4 packets EV5 packets: Bit1: EV5 packets Reserved: Bit2: Reserved AFH capable slave: Bit3: AFH capable slave AFH classification slave: Bit4: AFH classification slave BREDR Not Supported: Bit5: BR/EDR Not Supported LE Supported: Bit6: LE Supported EDR ACL 3 slot: Bit7: EDR ACL 3 slot
Byte5: bitfield: EDR ACL 5 slot: Bit0: EDR ACL 5 slot Sniff Subrating: Bit1: Sniff Subrating capable Pause Encryption: Bit 2: Encryption Pause Resume Feature Supported AFH capable master: Bit3: AFH capable master AFH classification master: Bit4: AFH classification master EDR eSCO DQPSM mode: Bit5: EDR eSCO DQPSM mode EDR eSCO 8 DPSK mode: Bit6: EDR eSCO 8 DPSK mode EDR eSCO 3 slot: Bit7: EDR eSCO 3 slot
Byte6: bitfield: Extended Inquiry Response: Bit0: Extended Inquiry Response Simultaneous LE and BREDR: Bit1: Simultaneous LE and BR/EDR Capable (Controller) Reserved0: Bit2 : Reserved Simple Pairing: Bit3:Simple Pairing Encapsulated PDU: Bit4: Encapsulated PDU Erroneous Data: Bit5: Erroneous Data QOS PBF: Bit6:QOS Packet Boundary Flag Reserved1: Bit7: Reserved
Byte7: bitfield: Link Supervision Timeout Changed Event: Bit0: Link Supervision Timeout Changed Event Inquiry Tx Power Level: Enhanced Power Control: Bit2: Enhanced Power Control feature Bluetooth_Supported_Features_Mask_Reserved_3: Reserved Bluetooth_Supported_Features_Mask_Reserved_4: Reserved Bluetooth_Supported_Features_Mask_Reserved_5: Reserved Bluetooth_Supported_Features_Mask_Reserved_6: Reserved Extended features: Bit7: Extended features

config_element.name: EXTENDED_FEATURE_MASK_PAGE_2
config_element.label: EXTENDED_FEATURE_MASK_PAGE_2
config_element.description_user:
Mask for Bluetooth spec defined extended feature list-Page 2.
Extended Feature Mask Page 2 fields:
Byte 0: bitfield: Connectionless slave Broadcast Master Role: Connectionless slave Broadcast Slave Role: Synchronization Train: Synchronization Scan: Inquiry Response Notification Event: Generalized interlaced scan: Coarse Clock Adjustment: Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved7: Reserved
Byte 1: bitfield: Secure Connections Controller: Ping: Slot Availability Mask: Train Nudging: Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved4: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved5: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved6: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved7: Reserved
Byte 2: bitfield: Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved0: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved1: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved2: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved3: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved4: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved5: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved6: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved7: Reserved
Byte 3: bitfield: Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved0: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved1: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved2: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved3: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved4: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved5: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved6: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved7: Reserved
Byte 4: bitfield: Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved0: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved1: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved2: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved3: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved4: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved5: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved6: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved7: Reserved
Byte 5: bitfield: Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved0: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved1: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved2: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved3: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved4: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved5: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved6: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved7: Reserved
Byte 6: bitfield: Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved0: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved1: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved2: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved3: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved4: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved5: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved6: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved7: Reserved
Byte 7: bitfield: Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved0: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved1: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved2: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved3: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved4: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved5: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved6: Reserved Extended_feature_mask_Page_2_Reserved7: Reserved

config_element.name: LE_SUPPORTED_FEATURES_MASK
config_element.label: LE_SUPPORTED_FEATURES_MASK
config_element.description_user:
The format of the LE Supported Features is defined in the BT specification. The LE_SUPPORTED_FEATURES_MASK is applied to the BT Supported Features such that a "0" bit forces the software to never support the given feature, while a "1" bit allows the software to support a given feature if the software is built with the required support.
LE Supported Features Mask fields:
Byte 0: bitfield: Encryption: Encryption Supported Conn_Param_Req: Connection Parameters Request Procedure Ext_Rej_Ind: Extended Reject Indication Slave_Init_Exch: Slave-initiated Features Exchange Ping: LE Ping Data Length Extension: LE Data Packet Length Extension LL Privacy: LE Privacy for Scanner and Advertiser. Extended Scanner Filter Policies: Extended Scanner Filter Policies
Byte 1: bitfield: 2 Mbps PHY: LE 2Ms/s Physical Data Rate Stable TX Modulation Index: Controller has a Stable TX Modulation Index Stable RX Modulation Index: Controller has a Stable RX Modulation Index Coded PHY: LE Coded PHY (125Kbps/500Kbps) Support Extended Advertising: LE Advertising Extension Support Periodic Advertising: LE Advertising Extension Support for Periodic advertising Channel Selection Algo 2: Support for LE channel selection algorithm 2 Power Class 1: Support for LE Power Class 1 feature.
Byte 2: bitfield: Minimum Channels Procedure: Support for minimum number of used channels procedure. Conn CTE Request: Connection CTE Request supported Conn CTE Response: Connection CTE Response supported Connless CTE Tx: Connectionless CTE Tx supported Connless CTE Rx: Connectionless CTE Rx supported AntSw CTE Tx: Antenna Switching During CTE Tx supported AntSw CTE Rx: Antenna Switching During CTE Rx supported LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_7: Reserved
Byte 3: bitfield: LE PAST Sender: LE PAST packet Tx support LE PAST Recipient: LE PAST packet Rx support. LE SCA Update: Sleep Clock Accuracy Communication Support. LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_3: Reserved LE CIS Master: Support LE ISO CIS Master role or not. LE CIS Slave: Support LE ISO CIS Slave role or not. LE BIS Master: Support LE ISO BIS Master role or not. aka. ISO Broadcast Tx. LE BIS Slave: Support LE ISO BIS Slave role or not. aka. ISO Broadcast Rx.
Byte 4: bitfield: LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_1: Reserved LE Path Loss Monitoring: LE Path Loss Monitoring LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_3: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_4: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_5: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_6: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_7: Reserved
Byte 5: bitfield: LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_0: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_1: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_2: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_3: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_4: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_5: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_6: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_7: Reserved
Byte 6: bitfield: LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_0: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_1: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_2: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_3: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_4: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_5: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_6: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_7: Reserved
Byte 7: bitfield: LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_0: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_1: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_2: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_3: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_4: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_5: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_6: Reserved LE_Supported_Features_Reserved_7: Reserved

config_element.name: BT_LOCAL_FEATURES_CONTROL_LOW_POWER_SCAN
config_element.label: BT_LOCAL_FEATURES_CONTROL_LOW_POWER_SCAN
config_element.description_user:
Low_Power_Scan fields:
LP_scanControl: LP_schedulePreSlotCount: The number of preslots to count prior to the follow on full power scan. LP_extendFollowScan: Number of slots to extend the follow on scan. Pad Byte: Pad to byte align following data LP_sniffMin: Normal power scans will be run unless the sniff interval is greater than LP_sniffMin. Units are in slots. LP_scanIntervalMin: Normal power scans will be run unless the interval between page scans is greater than LP_scanIntervalMin. Units are in slots.

config_element.name: BT_LOCAL_FEATURES_CONTROL_FORWARD_RATE_ADAPTATION
config_element.label: BT_LOCAL_FEATURES_CONTROL_FORWARD_RATE_ADAPTATION
config_element.description_user:
Forward Rate Adaptation fields:
FRA_WEIGHTING: The weighting given to repeats of ARQN 0s or 1s. Value stored in Q15. Default is 1/8. FRA_HIGH_THRESH: The threshold that must be crossed to move from prohibiting 3DH packets to allowing 3DH packets. Number is held in Q15 format. Default is 0.9. FRA_LOW_THRESH: The threshold that must be crossed from allowing 3DH packets to prohibiting 3DH packets. The number is held in Q15 format. Default is 0.4. FRA_MAX_RETRANS: The max number of repeated ARQNs that are allowed. FRA_ENABLED: Tag indicates whether the FRA feature is enabled or not.

config_element.name: BT_LOCAL_FEATURES_CONTROL_ACL_RX_PHYERROR_CONTROL
config_element.label: BT_LOCAL_FEATURES_CONTROL_ACL_RX_PHYERROR_CONTROL
config_element.description_user:
ACL RX PhyError Control fields:
Phy Err Ctrl Auto Abort: Filler: Filler for byte alignment Rec Included: bitfield: Rec Included: If 1, override Modem register setting with the data included in this record.
Phy Err Ctrl: bitfield: Phy Error Det Enable: PHY Error Detector Enable 0: DISABLE (Disable PHY Error Detector) 1: ENABLE (Enable PHY Error Detector) Payload Header Len: Use this parameter to select the duration of the beginning portion of the payload to place more weight 0x0: EIGHT_US (8us) 0x1: US (16us) 0x2: TWENTYFOUR_US (24us) 0x3: THIRTYTWO_US (32us) Payload Header Weight: Use this parameter to set the weight that is applied during the payload_header_length
GFSK Err Region: This threshold sets the region where the GFSK demodulators decision metric will be used to calculate the error metric for GFSK DQPSK Err Region: This threshold sets the region where the DQPSK demodulators decision metric will be used to calculate the error metric for DQPSK D8PSK Err Region: This threshold sets the region where the D8PSK demodulators decision metric will be used to calculate the error metric for D8PSK GFSK Err: If the error metric for GFSK is greater than this threshold, the erroneous_bit_detected is asserted DQPSK Err: If the error metric for DQPSK is greater than this threshold, the erroneous_bit_detected is asserted D8PSK Err: If the error metric for D8PSK is greater than this threshold, the erroneous_bit_detected is asserted

Byte0: bitfield: Split ACL: Split ACL support. TWS eSCO: TWS eSCO support. eSCO DTX: eSCO DTX support Higher Layer Channel Message: Higher Layer Channel Message support QHS-P2: BR/EDR Packet Emulation Mode including QHS-P2 packet support QHS-P3: QHS-P3 packet support QHS-P4: QHS-P4 packet support QHS-P5: QHS-P5 packet support
Byte1: bitfield: QHS-P6: QHS-P6 packet support Real Time Soft Combining: Real Time Soft Combining eSCO without MIC: QHS Classic Mode eSCO packets without MIC Separate ACL and eSCO Nonces: QHS Classic Mode Separate ACL and eSCO Nonces ACL Mirroring: ACL Mirroring eSCO Mirroring: eSCO Mirroring Non DM1 Encapsulated Payload: Non DM1 Encapsulated Payload
Byte2: bitfield: ACL Handover: ACL Handover eSCO Handover: eSCO Handover ACL Data Transfer SYNC Flag: ACL Data Transfer SYNC Flag
Byte3: bitfield: QHS Bug Fixes Batch 1: Device supports fixes to day counter initialization, crc and whitener seeding for QHS. QHS Bug Fixes Batch 2: Device supports fixes for AFH in QHS to be compliant regulatory specifications (ie guarantee min 15 channels, even use of channels, Japanese specification)
Byte4: bitfield:
Byte5: bitfield:
Byte6: bitfield:
Byte7: bitfield:
Byte8: bitfield:
Byte9: bitfield:
Byte10: bitfield:
Byte11: bitfield:
Byte12: bitfield:
Byte13: bitfield:
Byte14: bitfield:
Byte15: bitfield:

config_element.name: QLMP_CONTROL_ACL_EVAL_PERIOD
config_element.label: QLMP_CONTROL_ACL_EVAL_PERIOD

config_element.name: QLMP_CONTROL_PER_THRESHOLD
config_element.label: QLMP_CONTROL_PER_THRESHOLD
config_element.description_user:
PER Threshold fields:
2QHS Up One: Threshold PER for BT-QHS 2M Phy Rate up transition by one 2QHS Down One: Threshold PER for BT-QHS 2M Phy Rate down transition by one 3QHS Up One: Threshold PER for BT-QHS 3M Phy Rate up transition by one 3QHS Down One: Threshold PER for BT-QHS 3M Phy Rate down transition by one 4QHS Up One: Threshold PER for BT-QHS 4M Phy Rate up transition by one 4QHS Down One: Threshold PER for BT-QHS 4M Phy Rate down transition by one 4QHS Down Two: Threshold PER for BT-QHS 4M Phy Rate down transition by two 5QHS Up One: Threshold PER for BT-QHS 5M Phy Rate up transition by one 5QHS Down One: Threshold PER for BT-QHS 5M Phy Rate down transition by one 5QHS Down Two: Threshold PER for BT-QHS 5M Phy Rate down transition by two 5QHS To 2QHS: Threshold PER for BT-QHS5 to BT-QHS2 transition 6QHS Down One: Threshold PER for BT-QHS 6M Phy Rate down transition by one 6QHS Down Two: Threshold PER for BT-QHS 6M Phy Rate down transition by two 6QHS To 2QHS: Threshold PER for BT-QHS6 to BT-QHS2 transition

LEHS2 Up One: Threshold PER of LEHS2 up one. LEHS3 Up One: Threshold PER of LEHS2 up one. LEHS3 Down One: Threshold PER of LEHS3 down one. LEHS4 Up One: Threshold PER of LEHS4 up one. LEHS4 Down One: Threshold PER of LEHS4 down one. LEHS4 Down Two: Threshold PER of LEHS4 down two. LEHS5 Up One: Threshold PER of LEHS5 up one. LEHS5 Down One: Threshold PER of LEHS5 down one. LEHS5 Down Two: Threshold PER of LEHS5 down two. LEHS5 To LEHS2: Threshold PER of LEHS5 to LEHS2. LEHS6 Down One: Threshold PER of LEHS6 down one. LEHS6 Down Two: Threshold PER of LEHS6 down two. LEHS6 To LEHS2: Threshold PER of LEHS6 to LEHS2. Reserved:

config_element.name: DLE_LINK_SERVICE_MIN_THRESHOLD
config_element.label: DLE_LINK_SERVICE_MIN_THRESHOLD
config_element.description_user: This parameter defines a minimum threshold on % of LE connection intervals that can be served using a chosen extended data length. Minimum value for Minimum threshold to serve the link can be 1%. Maximum value for Minimum threshold to serve the link can be 100%. By default, we are inclined to set the maximum possible length with which the link can be served for minimum 25% of the time. The default value is quite low in order to be relax in terms of service the LE link and thus allows length selection algorithm to select a high data length.

config_element.name: AFHCSBCONTROL_ENABLECSBNEWAFHMAPEVENT
config_element.label: AFHCSBCONTROL_ENABLECSBNEWAFHMAPEVENT
config_element.description_user: If this flag is set to 1, vendor specific CsbNewAfhMapEvent is enabled. This means that when a new AFH map is available on the CSB broacaster, the controller won't update it but instead it will report this event for the host to take the decision. The amount of changes necessary for the map to be considered new is specified in AfhCsbMinMapChange.

config_element.name: ADD_ON_FEATURE_SUPPORT
config_element.label: ADD_ON_FEATURE_SUPPORT
config_element.description_user:
HOST team will be sending this command at the time of BT turn on and will take decisions based on these feature mask
Add On Feature Support fields:
Byte0: bitfield: WiPower Fastboot Enable: Split A2DP - Scramble Data Required: Split A2DP - 44p1Khz Sample Freq: Split A2DP - 48Khz Sample Freq: Split A2DP Single VS Command Support: Split A2DP Source - SBC Encoding: Reserved1: Reserved2:
Byte1: bitfield: Split A2DP Source - SBC: Split A2DP Source - MP3: Split A2DP Source - AAC: Split A2DP Source - LDAC: Split A2DP Source - APTX: Split A2DP Source - APTX HD: Split A2DP Source - APTX ADAPTIVE: Split A2DP Source - APTX TWS PLUS:
Byte2: bitfield: Split A2DP Sink - SBC: Split A2DP Sink - MP3: Split A2DP Sink - AAC: Split A2DP Sink - LDAC: Split A2DP Sink - APTX: Split A2DP Sink - APTX HD: Split A2DP Sink - APTX ADAPTIVE: Split A2DP Sink - APTX TWS PLUS:
Byte3: bitfield: Voice - Dual SCO: Voice - TWS Plus Dual eSCO AG: Voice - SWB APTX ADAPTIVE AG: Reserved3: Reserved4: Reserved5: Reserved6: Reserved7:
Byte4: bitfield: Broadcast Audio Tx with EC-2-5: Broadcast Audio Tx with EC-3-9: Broadcast Audio Rx with EC-2-5: Broadcast Audio Rx with EC-3-9:

config_element.name: HCI_UART_SETTINGS_H4_UART_CONFIG
config_element.label: HCI_UART_SETTINGS_H4_UART_CONFIG
config_element.description_user: None

config_element.name: HCI_UART_SETTINGS_USER_DEFINED_BAUD
config_element.label: HCI_UART_SETTINGS_USER_DEFINED_BAUD
config_element.description_user:
User Defined Baud fields:
Integer Rate Divisor: Integer Baud Rate divisor; Formula's to Calculate Baud Rate Registers: ibrd = ( BBCLK/(8*BAUD) ); For SiW1750/1760: BBCLK = 16,000,000; For the SiW3000 : BBCLK = 32,000,000; For QCA6174 2.x : BBCLK = 32,000,000; For QCA6174 3.x : BBCLK = 32,000,000 or 64,000,000 Fractional Rate Divisor: SiW1750/1760: BBCLK = 16,000,000; For the SiW3000 : BBCLK = 32,000,000; For QCA6174 2.x : BBCLK = 32,000,000; For QCA6174 3.x : BBCLK = 32,000,000 or 64,000,000 Reserved1: Padding bytes for alignment

config_element.name: SLEEP_CONTROL_SIBS_PARAMETERS
config_element.label: SLEEP_CONTROL_SIBS_PARAMETERS
config_element.description_user:
SIBS Parameters fields:
Wake Retransmission Timeout: Software In-Band Sleep Wake Retransmission Timeout in ms. Wake will be re-transmitted after this number of ms if a Wake Ack is not received. Tx Idle Timeout: Software In-Band Sleep Tx Idle Timeout in ms. Sleep signal will be sent if Tx stays idle for the defined timeout period. Options: bitfield: Wake Byte Required: When enabled (set to 1), an actual Wake byte must be received to respond with a Wake Ack byte. When disabled, a Wake Ack byte will be sent on wakeup due to any Rx activity. Dynamic Wake Retransmit Timeout: Wake Retransmit Timeout can be set to either constant value always or can be configured to increment dynamically based on number of Wake Indication Timeouts. When this BIT is set to 1: Wake Retransmit timeout will increment linearly. For example if the Wake Retransmit timeout is set to 10msec then Wake Indication will be sent out at 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60msec timeouts.

config_element.label: SLEEP_PARAMETERS_MIN_TIMER

config_element.name: SLEEP_PARAMETERS_CLOCK_LOCK_COUNT
config_element.label: SLEEP_PARAMETERS_CLOCK_LOCK_COUNT

config_element.label: HEADER_FEC_ERRORS_ALLOWED
config_element.description_user:
The number of allowed FEC errors before NACKing a packet. This parameter helps distinguish bad packets in the presence of 802.11 interference.
Header FEC Errors Allowed fields:
ACL: Number of header FEC errors allowed before NACKing an ACL packet SCO: Number of header FEC errors allowed before NACKing a SCO packet

config_element.name: PPM_DRIFT_RATE
config_element.label: PPM_DRIFT_RATE
config_element.description_user:
This parameter contains PPM drift rate for the low power oscillator that is reported over the air via the LMP_timing_accuracy PDU.When a 32kHz crystal (or clock) is used, the baseband will typically self calibrate this to 45 ppm using the 32MHz clock as a reference. When/If the internal 32kHz relaxation oscillator is used on the SIW3000, the tolerance will be different, so it will need to be reflected in this tag.This parameter does not affect the calibration procedure, only the reported accuracy.
PPM Drift Rate fields:
Drift Rate BTC: PPM Drift Rate for BT Classical (Default: 0x2D, 45d) Drift Rate BLE: PPM Drift Rate for BLE (Default: 0x2D, 45d)

config_element.name: BB_PRIORITY_XSCO_RESERVE
config_element.label: BB_PRIORITY_XSCO_RESERVE
config_element.description_user: Normal (non-boosted) priority for an xSCO reserved frame. In addition, for TWS+ eSCO connections, boosted LEFT retransmission frames will use this priority minus 1, and boosted RIGHT retransmission frames will use this priority minus 2 (to keep both retransmission frames lower priority than the reserved frames, and to keep the RIGHT retransmission frames lower priority than the LEFT).

config_element.name: BB_PRIORITY_XSCO_HIGH_BE
config_element.label: BB_PRIORITY_XSCO_HIGH_BE
config_element.description_user: Baseband Scheduling Priority

config_element.name: BB_PRIORITY_XSCO_HIGH
config_element.label: BB_PRIORITY_XSCO_HIGH
config_element.description_user: Priority for an xSCO reserved frame when temporarily boosted (when recent scheduling history indicates one or more missed reserved frames).

config_element.name: BB_PRIORITY_XSCO_RETRAN
config_element.label: BB_PRIORITY_XSCO_RETRAN
config_element.description_user: Normal (non-boosted) priority for an xSCO retransmission frame. Retransmission frames are boosted when they are needed (due to bad Rx in previous frame, receiving a NAK, etc). When boosted, xSCO retransmission frames get assigned the same priority as was used for the corresponding reserved frame. For TWS+ RIGHT eSCO connections, a normal (non-boosted) xSCO retransmission frame will use this priority minus 1 (to keep the RIGHT retransmission priority lower than the LEFT).

config_element.name: LE_POWER_CONFIGURATION
config_element.label: LE_POWER_CONFIGURATION
config_element.description_user:
These parameters control LE TX output power configuration.
LE Power Configuration fields:
Advertising Power Level Index: Advertising power level index (Default=0x7, 7d). Host can control range by limiting Tx Output Power. This Tx Power is used for Advertising and Scan Response. Negative PL can be specified as 0x20(-1) ~ 0x23(-4). Scan Request Power Level Index: Scan Request Tx Power Level Index (Default=0x7, 7d). Host can control range by limiting Tx Output Power. Negative PL can be specified as 0x20(-1) ~ 0x23(-4). Connection Power Level Index: Connection power level index (Default=0x7, 7d). Negative PL can be specified as 0x20(-1) ~ 0x23(-4). MultiAdvTxPower_min: Negative PL can be specified as 0x20(-1) ~ 0x23(-4). MultiAdvTxPower_low: Negative PL can be specified as 0x20(-1) ~ 0x23(-4). MultiAdvTxPower_mid: Negative PL can be specified as 0x20(-1) ~ 0x23(-4). MultiAdvTxPower_high: Negative PL can be specified as 0x20(-1) ~ 0x23(-4). MultiAdvTxPower_max: Negative PL can be specified as 0x20(-1) ~ 0x23(-4).

config_element.name: MEMORY_POOL_CONFIG_GMEM
config_element.label: MEMORY_POOL_CONFIG_GMEM
config_element.description_user:
GENERIC POOL CONFIG fields:
mem config: bitfield: section: 00: lower heap only; 01: upper heap only; prealloc: Preallocate memory
max count: minimum memory blocks allocated when memory pool is initialized. block size: maximum memory blocks allowed to be allocated from memory pool.

HCI_DATA_TX fields:
block config: bitfield: section: prealloc: NVMSection:
max count: block size: The size of each Tx buffer, in bytes (Default: 1036 (0x408)). The ACL_U Isochronous Flush mechanism clock tags each Tx HCI data packet. This allocation needs to account 4 bytes for this clock tag. Note: The BB Tx mechanism builds baseband ACL packets by concatenating up to three HCI Tx packets. If the specified Tx packet size is to small ( <117 bytes BR, <345 bytes EDR) smaller BT packets will be used to Tx the data.

config_element.name: MEMORY_POOL_CONFIG_HCI_DATA_RX
config_element.label: MEMORY_POOL_CONFIG_HCI_DATA_RX
config_element.description_user:
HCI_DATA_RX fields:
block config: bitfield: section: prealloc: NVMSection:
max count: block size: The size of each Rx buffer, in bytes (Default: 1028 (0x404)). Note: The baseband Rx mechanism expects a minimum Rx packet size of 64 bytes. If a smaller value is specified, ACL data traffic will stall due to insufficient buffering to handle an incomming BT Rx ACL packet.

config_element.name: HCI_VOICE_SAMPLE_COUNT
config_element.label: HCI_VOICE_SAMPLE_COUNT
config_element.description_user:
This tag allows to specify the criteria for stuffing and flushing samples in SCO over HCI path.
HCI Voice sample count fields:
Low threshold: This specifies the far_too_low threshold value in multiples of the number of samples required for framing an OTA packet. If sample count is less than this value the boost the ring. High threshold: This specifies the far_too_high threshold value in multiples of the number of samples. If sample count exceeds this value then flush the ring.
